resources.string: Are you sure you want to delete this argument?

Shadowsocks-Android connects to a local Shadowsocks server on ${local.host}:${local:port} which must be setup by GOST. This service is usually specified through the first -L argument. Further forwarding nodes (i.e., the -F arguments) and other GOST related command line arguments shall be specified in sequence by user through provided controls below. You may refer to ${remote.host} and ${remote.port} in values of arguments which are then replaced with configured Server and Remote port, respectively. To avoid unnecessary performance hit, no encryption is used by default, and hence, Encrypt Method must be set to NONE for default setup in Shadowsocks-Android profile settings. You need to restart corresponding profile for changes to take effect.
The following config.yaml is already included. You may leave it empty or use it to fine tune GOST per its documentation
Are you sure you want to delete this file?\nFile name:
Still reading the previous file, please try later
Error! File is too large (larger than 1M)

# sample config, won't be saved or applied
chains:
- name: chain-0
	hops:
	- name: hop-0
		nodes:
		- name: node-0
			addr: example.com:443
			connector:
				type: http
				metadata:
					path: /ws
			dialer:
				type: wss
				tls:
					secure: true
					serverName: example.com
				metadata:
					path: /ws
log:
	level: debug
-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----\n(Your own CA certificate in Base64 PEM format)\n-----END CERTIFICATE-----
-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----\n(Your own client certificate in Base64 PEM format)\n-----END CERTIFICATE-----
-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY-----\n(Your own client certificate key in Base64 PEM format)\n-----END RSA PRIVATE KEY-----
Migrate to the new encoded configuration format

New encoded configuration format allows user to utilize the full GOST functionality without experiencing weired issues related to CLI parsing. Note that after migration to new format, old values won\'t be recoverable.
Successfully migrated to new config format
Error migrating to new config format
Press back button again to continue editing.
Currently, GOST uses its own name resolution mechanism and won\'t use the system DNS settings. Specify the desired DNS as 119.29.29.29:53.
